  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String socketIP, String nickName, int score)
      The Player function is a constructor for the Player class. It takes in three parameters: socketIP, nickName, and score. The function sets the instance variables of this class to be equal to these parameters.
      Parameters:
      socketIP - Store the ip address of the player's socket
      nickName - Set the player's nickname
      score - Set the currentscore and prevscore to a certain value

    • usingCurrentTiles

      public boolean usingCurrentTiles(String word)
      The usingCurrentTiles function checks if the word that is being placed on the board can be made using only tiles from the currentTiles array.
      Parameters:
      word - Check if the word is in the dictionary
      Returns:
      True if the word can be formed using the current tiles, otherwise it returns false

    • parseStringToCharacterArray

      public Character[][] parseStringToCharacterArray(String boardString)
      The parseStringToCharacterArray function takes a String representation of the board and returns a 2D Character array representing the same board. The function is used to convert from one representation to another, which can be useful for testing purposes. For example, if you have an implementation that uses Strings as input but you want to test it with your implementation that uses 2D arrays as input, then this function will allow you to do so. It also allows us (the TAs) to test your code using our own implementations of BogglePlayer without having access to your source code! This is called "black box" testing.
      Parameters:
      boardString - Store the boardstring
      Returns:
      A 2d array of characters

    • getCurrentBoardAsTiles

      public Tile[][] getCurrentBoardAsTiles()
      The getCurrentBoardAsTiles function is a helper function that returns the current board as an array of tiles.
      Returns:
      A 2d array of tile objects
